markdown:
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 45 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 43 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 40 [Ran-to (Level 16)](/NPCs.aspx?ID=1495) **Source** [Pathfinder #167: Ready? Fight!](/Sources.aspx?ID=86) pg. 37 **Perception** +23; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6), [Tien](/Languages.aspx?ID=43), [Ysoki](/Languages.aspx?ID=61) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +26, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +35, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +26, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +25, [Wrestling Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +21 **Str** +7 **Dex** +4 **Con** +6 **Int** -1 **Wis** +1 **Cha** +2 **Items** _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [gauntlet](/Weapons.aspx?ID=4)_, _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [halfling sling staff](/Weapons.aspx?ID=78)_ (20 bullets and 5 _[greater explosive bullets](/Equipment.aspx?ID=162)_), _+2 [resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=279) [studded leather armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=5)_ --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +30 **Ref** +26 **Will** +23 **HP** 380 **[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** When a creature triggers Ran-to's Attack of Opportunity, he can attempt an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) the triggering creature instead of making a melee Strike. He can still disrupt a triggering [manipulate](/Actions.aspx?ID=639) action if he critically succeeds at his attempt. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _gauntlet_ +33 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Free-Hand](/Traits.aspx?ID=181)), **Damage** 3d4+17 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Ranged** _halfling sling staff_ +30 ([Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 80 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 3d10+11 bludgeoning **Body Slam** **Requirements** Ran-to has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33); **Effect** Ran-to throws his foe to the ground. The grabbed creature takes 10d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save) and is knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31). The grab ends. **Greater Leaping Catch** Ran-to bounds up and attempts to Grab a foe while he soars. He makes a [Leap](/Actions.aspx?ID=81), [High Jump](/Actions.aspx?ID=36), or [Long Jump](/Actions.aspx?ID=37). His maximum distance is 75 feet. He must succeed at an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to perform the leap as usual, but regardless of the type of leap the DC is equal to half the number of feet he moves in the air. Ran-to can attempt an Athletics check to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) at any point during the jump. Immediately after the attempt, he (and the creature, if the Grapple was successful) falls to the ground. Ran-to takes no falling damage when using this ability, but the [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) creature takes the appropriate amount of falling damage as if they had fallen the distance moved. **Titan Wrestler** Ran-to can attempt to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41), [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35), [Shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=38), or [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40) creatures up to two sizes larger than him. **Whirlwind Toss** **Frequency** once per round; **Requirements** Ran-to has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33); **Effect** Ran-to spins the creature he's holding, smashing them against any creatures within his reach, and then throws the creature aside. Ran-to attempts an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC.
**Critical Success** Ran-to tosses his foe a great distance. The grab ends. The grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 10 feet, takes 12d6 bludgeoning damage, and falls [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31). All creatures adjacent to Ran-to take the same amount of bludgeoning damage (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).
**Success** As critical success, except the grabbed creatures is thrown into a space within 5 feet, and creatures take 8d6 bludgeoning damage.
**Failure** Ran-to tosses his foe aside. The grab ends. The grabbed creature falls prone.
**Critical Failure** Ran-to loses hold of his foe, causing the grapple to end.
name: Ran-to (Level 16)

text: Ran-to (Level 16) Recall Knowledge - Humanoid (Society): DC 45 Unspecific Lore : DC 43 Specific Lore : DC 40 Ran-to (Level 16) Source Pathfinder #167: Ready? Fight! pg. 37 Perception +23; darkvision Languages Common, Goblin, Tien, Ysoki Skills Acrobatics +26, Athletics +35, Intimidation +26, Survival +25, Wrestling Lore +21 Str +7 Dex +4 Con +6 Int -1 Wis +1 Cha +2 Items +2 greater striking gauntlet , +2 greater striking halfling sling staff (20 bullets and 5 greater explosive bullets ), +2 resilient studded leather armor --- AC 38 Fort +30 Ref +26 Will +23 HP 380 Attack of Opportunity Reaction When a creature triggers Ran-to's Attack of Opportunity, he can attempt an Athletics check to Grapple the triggering creature instead of making a melee Strike. He can still disrupt a triggering manipulate action if he critically succeeds at his attempt. --- Speed 25 feet Melee Single Action gauntlet +33 (Agile, Free-Hand), Damage 3d4+17 bludgeoning plus Improved Grab Ranged Single Action halfling sling staff +30 (Propulsive, range increment 80 feet, reload 1), Damage 3d10+11 bludgeoning Body Slam Single Action Requirements Ran-to has a creature grabbed or restrained; Effect Ran-to throws his foe to the ground. The grabbed creature takes 10d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 37 basic Fortitude save) and is knocked prone. The grab ends. Greater Leaping Catch Two Actions Ran-to bounds up and attempts to Grab a foe while he soars. He makes a Leap, High Jump, or Long Jump. His maximum distance is 75 feet. He must succeed at an Athletics check to perform the leap as usual, but regardless of the type of leap the DC is equal to half the number of feet he moves in the air. Ran-to can attempt an Athletics check to Grapple at any point during the jump. Immediately after the attempt, he (and the creature, if the Grapple was successful) falls to the ground. Ran-to takes no falling damage when using this ability, but the grabbed creature takes the appropriate amount of falling damage as if they had fallen the distance moved. Titan Wrestler Ran-to can attempt to Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip creatures up to two sizes larger than him. Whirlwind Toss Three Actions Frequency once per round; Requirements Ran-to has a creature grabbed or restrained; Effect Ran-to spins the creature he's holding, smashing them against any creatures within his reach, and then throws the creature aside. Ran-to attempts an Athletics check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC. Critical Success Ran-to tosses his foe a great distance. The grab ends. The grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 10 feet, takes 12d6 bludgeoning damage, and falls prone. All creatures adjacent to Ran-to take the same amount of bludgeoning damage (DC 37 basic Reflex save). Success As critical success, except the grabbed creatures is thrown into a space within 5 feet, and creatures take 8d6 bludgeoning damage. Failure Ran-to tosses his foe aside. The grab ends. The grabbed creature falls prone. Critical Failure Ran-to loses hold of his foe, causing the grapple to end.
